description: inside a wooden box with no inscription on lid; no tissue around outside of scroll; paper under tie and around scroll; dark wooden roller; olive green support fabric with gold accent; image is a cliff with a tree and house at the top with figure at the top of a path leading down; path and tree trunk are red/brown in color; two lines of inscription along LL edge; three red chops, two square chops on the bottom of the inscription and a rectangular one UR corner
inscription: 雲本無心舒　花絶無草過　小人求諸奴　非是佛經法 (Clouds, lacking any mind, unfold; / Flowers—utterly nonexistent!—fade. / The petty man seeks truth from slaves: / This is not the dharma of Buddha\'s sutras.) [Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #2]; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]
text:
雲本無心舒　
花絶無草過　
小人求諸奴　
非是佛經法
Clouds, lacking any mind, unfold;
Flowers—utterly nonexistent!—fade.
The petty man seeks truth from slaves:
This is not the dharma of Buddha’s sutras.
title: Running Water and Plum Blossoms
